page.title: 07PSYCHIATRY IN STAFFORD
page.content: Sarah's father is a psychiatrist at St.George's Hospital Stafford.He tries to understand and treat sick minds.He treats his patients in the local hospitals and sometimes at home. Depression,hallucination,agoraphobia ,schizophrenia are some of the mental illnesses he treats.Talking to and with patients is the way the doctor sorts out the problems.He helps about 1000 patients a year. He does not wear a uniform.Dr Cooper did 5 years training to be a medical doctor and a further 7 years to become a psychiatrist.Drugs such as lithium,anti-depressants and tranquillisers are used for treating patients.Loss of memory in old people can be helped by taking vitamins. Occupational therapy helps to keep minds working.One person in ten will need psychiatric treatment during their lifetime.
